item.title: Ticket #53054 (Hyperlink color not visible) closed
item.dc:creator: sabernhardt
item.description:
invalid:

Hi @nithin25 !

For help with your site, you would want the support forums instead of Trac.
​https://wordpress.org/support/

Editing styles in Customizer adjusts the theme, but the Style Kit created by/with a plugin is overriding those link styles. You could re-define the color within the Elementor interface, but I think clicking the undo arrow icon (or "clear") to remove the special style would be better.

Since this is not a core bug, I'm closing the ticket.

item.title: Ticket #52111 (Classic Editor - TinyMCE Visual Page editor not working correctly ...) updated
item.dc:creator: yeisonbp
item.description:
Hi, with our current plugin, Get Awesome Support, each customer and each site we have we see this error as well. Our developers confirmed that this is from the WordPress side. you can install it an replicate it:

  • Install Awesome Support (free)
  • Log in as a support agent role
  • Create a ticket (choose a ticket creator) and click on the blue "open ticket" button.
  • choose the same ticket, add a reply and click on the "reply" button.
  • Now that you have a new ticket and a ticket reply, click on the ticket again and go to the reply. Click on the pencil icon "edit ticket" button and you will see the error message.

Thanks.

item.title: Ticket #52654 (Check and recommend intl extension in Site Health) updated
item.dc:creator: Clorith
item.description:
Keywords, Type changed

Is the Normalizer class still maintained and going to be a thing moving forward?

A quick look at the ​PHP documentation shows it's available in PHP 5.3 and PHP 7, but not PHP 8, but then rather as an optional install via the intl PECL package.

The latter makes it seem like a non-starter based on the linked Hosting Team discussion on criteria for recommendations, but I'm open to it if the Hosting Team feels strongly about this as well, as the ones most likely to get requests for this.

item.title: Ticket #52753 (using_index_permalinks() on null) updated
item.dc:creator: Clorith
item.description:
Keywords changed

Hiya,

This appears related to the change in asynchronous tests being moved to the REST API, and the calls to rest_url in the test generator function you are calling.

The rest_url function relies on the $wp_rewrite global class when pretty permalinks are enabled, which isn't available as early as the plugins_loaded action, but should instead be used with either the init or wp hook.

item.title: Ticket #52244 (required valid URL for WordPress "recovery mode" given URL is not ...) closed
item.dc:creator: Clorith
item.description:
worksforme:

Hi there, and welcome to WordPress trac!

The problem you are describing usually means that the recovery token could not be found in the database, this could mean it was already used, or that it was not able to be saved in the first place.

It appears your site is now functioning as it should, in future situations you may have better luck through our ​support forums, as they would be able to help you troubleshoot your site and why this is failing.

As this appears to be a site error, and not a WordPress one, I'm going to close this ticket for now, but if evidence indicating otherwise should be discovered, we can re-open the ticket to investigate further.

item.title: Ticket #52335 (Automatic report Fatal Error) updated
item.dc:creator: Clorith
item.description:
Keywords, Version changed

I'm not sure if this is a good idea, it would lead to a lot of messy and (often times incorrect) information being pushed towards the ticketing system here.

There's also the concern that you need a WordPress.org account to create tickets, opening this up to just allow anyone to push tickets would be a potential outlet for abuse.

If a host or similar wanted to capture errors and function as a warden and file upstream tickets to trac for legitimate issues, this is already possible through the use of filters, like for example wp_php_error_message in a platform-dependent mu plugin or similar, or their own custom error handler.

With this in mind, I'm going to suggest this ticket be closed, but will leave it open for a while to see if there's others opinions.

item.title: Ticket #48929 (Recovery mode page references checking your site admin email, even in ...) updated
item.dc:creator: Clorith
item.description:
Keywords changed

Thank you very much for your report of this @rkaiser0324, you are quite right that this is text was misleading.

48929.patch​ is a suggested resolution, where the text is more aware of the current site setup, providing different texts if it is a protected endpoint, but you are, or are not, on a multisite install.

Standalone site:

There has been a critical error on this website. Please check your site admin email inbox for instructions.

Multisite:

There has been a critical error on this website. Please reach out to your site administrator, and inform them of this error for further assistance.

I opted for the term site administrator over network administrator, as the last one also has meanings for businesses where this is also used as the term for whomever handles networking issues in the office or similar.

item.title: 48929.patch attached to Ticket #48929
item.dc:creator: Clorith

item.title: Ticket #53052 (WordPress installed a new installation over my existing wordpress website) updated
item.dc:creator: SergeyBiryukov
item.description:
Hi there, welcome to WordPress Trac! Thanks for the report.

I received an email from wordpress.org this morning, informing me that you had installed a new wp installation over my existing wp website and it is no longer working.

I'm sorry to hear you are having issues with your website. Just to clarify, as noted above, that email comes from your web server, not from WordPress.org.

As also noted above, WordPress.org has no way of performing a new installation like that. It can only update an existing installation based on your auto-update settings, but that would result in a different email. A new installation can only be done by someone with direct access to your server, either the website developer or the hosting provider you're using.

Please try the support forums to get help with your site: ​https://wordpress.org/support/forums/.

item.title: Ticket #53052 (WordPress installed a new installation over my existing wordpress website) closed
item.dc:creator: knutsp
item.description:
invalid:

Hello @TalkBaja, welcome to Trac and thanks for the ticket.

I'm sorry to hear you have had such serious trouble with your installation of WordPress.

First of all, wordpress.org does not, never, install - or reinstall - WordPress for users.

The email is generated and sent from the new installation of WordPress on your site.

If WordPress was to reinstalled over a current one, as long as the database tables or wp-config.php is not changed or removed, it would not make your site empty. It happens every time on updates. If, say a tiny, but important, thing like the $table_prefix in wp-config.php is changed, WordPress will assume it's not installed and allow anyone - anyone - to install WordPress. If wp-config.php is tampered with, it may mean you are - your server is - hacked.

A starting point may be ​https://wordpress.org/support/article/faq-my-site-was-hacked/

I close this ticket, as there is nothing we - developers and contributors - can do form here and based on this information.

I sincerely hope you are able to restore your site and find out what happened.

item.title: Ticket #52933 (Error in browser console when newly published post is previewed a ...) updated
item.dc:creator: Rahmohn
item.description:
I've tested this and can reproduce the issue too.

The issue happens if there is already an autosave and the user clicks in "Preview in new tab" because this button ​always tries to autosave the post. So another way to reproduce this issue is by clicking on "Preview in new tab", reload the page and try to preview again.

Other than that, Autosaves controller ​deletes the autosave when the post data is the same. So the next time the user tries to preview the issue doesn't happen.

It's not clear to me the best approach to fix it. We can prevent the "Preview in new tab" button to send the request when the content hasn't changed. The behavior would be like the "Update" button. The second approach is changing the Autosave controller to return the previous autosave if the content is the same instead of a Bad Request (HTTP 400).

item.dc:creator: TalkBaja
item.description:
My website is now blank - I received an email from wordpress.org this morning, informing me that you had installed a new wp installation over my existing wp website and it is no longer working. Who authorized you to do this? Your email stated the following:

Your new WordPress site has been successfully set up at:

​https://talkbaja.com

You can log in to the administrator account with the following information:

Username: testadmin
Password: The password you chose during installation.
Log in here: ​https://talkbaja.com/wp-login.php

We hope you enjoy your new site. Thanks!

--The WordPress Team
​https://wordpress.org/

item.title: Ticket #53051 (PHP Warning from callback function 'wc_loop_shop_columns') closed
item.dc:creator: knutsp
item.description:
invalid:

Hello @chef1974, welcome to Trac and thanks for the ticket.

This Trac is for bug tracking and enhancements of the WordPress core software, not for individual support. Even if the PHP warning comes form a core function, this is not a core issue.

The filter wc_loop_shop_columns seems to be applied by the WooCommerce plugin. It may be added (used) by your active theme or another active plugin. I suggest deactivating one by one, change theme, and see if it goes away, then asking in their support forums, or generally in ​https://wordpress.org/support/forums/

Closing this, as no action can be taken form this Trac.

also when frontpage load, displays , then white speed , then after about 5 seconds site live, thats all this about?
the function is call from your wp-include, is that an error in the script?

item.title: Ticket #49814 (health-check-site-status-result ajax requestS on dashboard) closed
item.dc:creator: Clorith
item.description:
fixed:

In 50766:

Site Health: Remove Ajax requests from dashboard widget.

The Site Health dashboard widget uses the same JavaScript file as the Site Health pages to generate its progress indicator.

This file was also set up to store the current Site Health check results if the current tab being shown isn't the debug information one, this had the side effect of the dashboard being seen as not the debug screen as well.

This now has a conditional making sure it's the status screen it self being displayed, before trying to do any Ajax requests.

Props arena.
Fixes #49814.

item.title: Changeset [50766]: Site Health: Remove Ajax requests from dashboard widget. The Site ...
item.dc:creator: Clorith
item.description:
Site Health: Remove Ajax requests from dashboard widget.

The Site Health dashboard widget uses the same JavaScript file as the Site Health pages to generate its progress indicator.

This file was also set up to store the current Site Health check results if the current tab being shown isn't the debug information one, this had the side effect of the dashboard being seen as not the debug screen as well.

This now has a conditional making sure it's the status screen it self being displayed, before trying to do any Ajax requests.

Props arena. Fixes #49814.

You are quite right, it actually shouldn't be triggering any ajax calls at all, as they are intended to save the results of a Site Health check when visiting the Site Health page it self.

49814.patch​ adds some new conditional checks to the JavaScript file, making sure the relevant pieces of code only run on the appropriate Site Health related pages.

This ensures even if the tab order is changed, or tabs are removed, no warnings will be thrown.

item.title: Ticket #53048 (PHPMailer uses hardcoded default sender mail address, preventing mail ...) closed
item.dc:creator: knutsp
item.description:
invalid:

Nice to hear you were able to make it work on your installation.

There are multiple reasons why outgoing mail doesn't work, depending on hosting server config and the mail server (MX) for the domain. Some need to set up SMTP. Hosting providers and server admins should ensure sending emails through phpmailer just work, even from non-existing addresses, at least wordpress@ or provide instructions and alternatives, IMO.

Th WordPress community could provide better instructions and troubleshooting tips for sending emails on ​https://wordpress.org/support/ even if there are plenty using Google.

item.title: Ticket #43289 (Twenty Seventeen: Menu link to front page won't display the page content) closed
item.dc:creator: poena
item.description:
worksforme:

Hi
I am sorry that you both had to wait so long for a reply.

This is the intended behavior when you set a page as the static front page.
When a menu has a link to the page, the link will lead to the front page, where the page you selected will be displayed. The link will not lead to a single page as example.com/page-slug/

To be sure that there are no issues related to displaying the content, I have tested this with Twenty Seventeen version 1.4 and version 2.6 on WordPress version 5.7.1

item.title: Ticket #40582 (Capitalize character - "CTRL + a" -> "CTRL + A") updated
item.dc:creator: sabernhardt
item.description:
To match wp-includes/class-wp-editor.php, 40582.tinymce.diff​ has lowercase letters after the capital C: Ctrl + V. Likewise, 40582.permalink.diff​ has Ctrl + A, and it includes some small grammatical changes.

These patches are purposely separate because ticket:40763#comment:6 recommended the removal of Ctrl + A and "we" wording (see also #46057). So I'll open a new ticket to explore more substantial Permalinks text changes (#53141) and to add label tags for each textarea (#53142).

item.title: 40582.permalink.diff attached to Ticket #40582
item.dc:creator: sabernhardt

item.title: 40582.tinymce.diff attached to Ticket #40582
item.dc:creator: sabernhardt

item.title: Ticket #47225 (Add new actions to Site Health navigation) closed
item.dc:creator: Clorith
item.description:
fixed:

In 50764:

Site Health: Support custom sub-menus and pages.

Allow developers to extend the Site Health screen with their own custom navigation tabs and pages.

This implements a new filter, site_health_navigation_tabs, which takes an associated array of tab identifiers/slugs, and tab labels, allowing developers to add their own subpage to the Site Health interface as new tabs.

To output a custom page, or add to an existing page, the site_health_tab_content action is triggered whenever the tab query argument is present and not empty. This action includes the current tab as its argument, which a developer would match against to only output content when relevant.

Props ramiy for initial patch.
Fixes #47225.

item.description:
Site Health: Support custom sub-menus and pages.

Allow developers to extend the Site Health screen with their own custom navigation tabs and pages.

This implements a new filter, site_health_navigation_tabs, which takes an associated array of tab identifiers/slugs, and tab labels, allowing developers to add their own subpage to the Site Health interface as new tabs.

To output a custom page, or add to an existing page, the site_health_tab_content action is triggered whenever the tab query argument is present and not empty. This action includes the current tab as its argument, which a developer would match against to only output content when relevant.

Props ramiy for initial patch. Fixes #47225.

item.title: Ticket #40426 (Remove dns-prefetch of s.w.org domain) updated
item.dc:creator: sabernhardt
item.description:
Keywords, Component changed

I considered making the filter default an empty string (or boolean false), but that wouldn't solve the situation with self-hosted emoji. So I simply refreshed the first patch.

For a temporary fix, I have used the filter to remove the link tag in a plugin:

add_filter( 'emoji_svg_url', '__return_false' );

item.title: 40426.diff attached to Ticket #40426
item.dc:creator: sabernhardt
item.description: refreshed patch

item.title: Ticket #53031 (Display counts for available plugin and theme updates on update-core.php) updated
item.dc:creator: sabernhardt
item.description:
Thank you both for the quick feedback.

The variable names include "count" and the PHP combines heading text with the count. I also used the number format function in case it's necessary.

Would it be easier to read the printf with the heading tag inside there, too?

	$themes_count = count( $themes );
	printf(
		'<h2>%s <span class="count">(%d)</span></h2>',
		__( 'Themes' ),
		number_format_i18n( $themes_count )
	);
	?>

item.title: Ticket #47225 (Add new actions to Site Health navigation) updated
item.dc:creator: Clorith
item.description:
Version, Milestone changed

47225.2.patch​ expands on the suggested approach from @ramiy.

Since this needs to account for IE 11, which does not support dynamic grid columns. The patch allows for up to 4 items being displayed at once (which has shown itself to be a good number in the Health Check plugin).

This is done by introducing a new site_health_navigation_tabs filter, taking an assocaited array of tab slugs and labels, as in the example below.

$tabs = array(
        /* translators: Tab heading for Site Health Status page. */
        ''      => _x( 'Status', 'Site Health' ),
        /* translators: Tab heading for Site Health Info page. */
        'debug' => _x( 'Info', 'Site Health' ),
);

This would lead to the example shown in 4-menu-items.PNG​.

If more than 4 menu items are present, then 3 items, and an ellipsis toggle is shown instead, as seen in 5-menu-items-collapsed.PNG​, this maintains a predictable UI for the end user, without overloading the navigation (or requiring a lot of CSS, as each new tab we allow for needs custom CSS in place). Expanding everything leaves you with 5-menu-items-expanded.PNG​.

The actual content of the custom tab is then output with the new action site_health_tab_content , where the current tab is passed as the argument. This means that developers would also be able to extend each others tabs. And thanks to some quick refactoring to make sure core uses the same features for its debug information tab, also extend the debug page to their benefit if they wish to. The exception here is the initial Status tab, which does not trigger the tab action, but is extensible in other ways.

Tab content that should be output would be whatever the developer wishes to output, there is no wrapper, so the full viewport width is available to them.

item.dc:creator: sabernhardt
